Reviews.Title: “Did not receive my request”
Reviews.Author: C V Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had asked for a quiet room that did not face the traffic/not close to the exit...oops! That didn't happen. Top that off with a door in the middle of the room that connects with the room next door that has a 2" wide opening at the bottom...we were awakened by drunks that came to their room yelling and cussing at each other. If they hadn't asked any special request, I could understand, so why ask, then not make the accommodation? I would recommend asking the clerk, not going through the Internet, because we wanted to sleep, not party.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Motel”
Reviews.Author: DocSavage_007
Reviews.Content: I stay at La Quintas quite often so have seen many. This one is very nice and new, and has their wonderful pillow top beds with great pillows, nice 32 inch flat screen TV. It is very well furnished and spotlessly clean. My room was on the side facing the freeway, but with the thick walls I really couldn't hear a thing from the road. Check in was quick and efficient. The rooms are nice and spacious, great soft chair to sit in and watch some games on TV, nice desk and chair. Breakfast is typical continental breakfast - same as most La Quintas. The only real drawback for visitors to San Diego is that the location is about 20 minutes (north) from most of San Diego. If you are doing things in the northern SD area, it should be great for you. Overall, nice, quiet, clean, and comfortable. The staff is very nice and very helpful. Overall, a great value for the money - better than you'll get most other places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: LinasReview
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at this LQ hotel, I was a bit apprehensive. The location is right off the freeway, I-15. There were some questionable folks parked in the back parking lot. BUT, I have to say, after my first night there, I felt comfortable. The room was very clean and newly renovated. It was not perfect, I had not frig or microwave. The continental breakfast was not the best. There is an I-Hop, Starbucks, and Mexican Restaurant right there. But I would hope that the LQ would improve their coffee so folks won't have to walk to Star-bucks. The staff was nice and friendly. It was also dog friendly. YES, I would stay there again. It was centrally located to all the places I needed to be in San Diego, Poway and Rancho Bernard. The town is very easy to get around. Thank you LQ-Scripps Poway. I was impressed and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: rollinwiththetide
Reviews.Content: I have never written an online review of anything before, but after the nightmare that has occurred at LaQuinta Inn (Scripps Poway location) I thought I had to warn others so that they could avoid the mistake of staying in this hotel all together. 1 exit south of this hotel on Interstate 15 are 2 hotels that are much better. The stay at LaQuinta started off badly when we went to check in and were told that they didn't have the room that we reserved available. They set us up with another room not of equal value until the type of room that we reserved originally would become available. A few nights passed by and my wife and I needed to go do laundry since this hotel doesn't have a laundry facility on site for guest use. After returning from doing laundry she stepped onto the elevator first when the ceiling of it came crashing down onto her. We made the front desk aware of it and an out of order sign was placed on the elevator. Two days later we still had heard nothing from the manager about what was going to be done to take care of it. We did hear from the front desk during that time, but only to tell us that we needed to move rooms because our room had leaky pipes that were letting water drip down into the front desk area. They relocated us and after a total of 3 days from when the elevator ceiling crashed, and I had still not heard from the manager I called LaQuinta's customer service number. They took down all of the information and said they would be in contact with the hotel. 2 days after I called customer service we received a letter from the manager that was left for us at the front desk. They basically just gave us 1 complimentary night and told us to rent a movie that would be comped and gave us a pack of "delicious" popcorn to enjoy with our movie. This could easily be a lawsuit for this LaQuinta yet they only comped 1 night with a movie and popcorn. When this happened I ended up looking for another hotel even though I was supposed to be at LaQuinta for 12 more days. I found Residence Inn which is pet friendly and only 1 exit south from where the LaQuinta from hell was. Not only was it pet friendly, but much nicer and with much better amenities. Not only is it pet friendly as well, but there is also not pet poop all over the grounds. We did get a first floor room at Residence Inn though since you never know when an elevator ceiling is going to fall. Do yourself a favor and don't stay here, just go 1 more exit south. It is a world of difference. Not only would I not recommend this hotel to a friend, but I also would not recommend this hotel to an enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Room ok, bathroom was terrible.”
Reviews.Author: bibi9333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night and were satisfied with the room but the bathroom was disgusting. It smelled like an ashtray and the tub was moldy. Thank goodness we could close the door and not look or smell it. It was over priced at $74 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: chris0914
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite with a king bed at La Quinta for two nights on Travelocity. When I checked in the lady working the front desk said we don't have a suite for you. I explained that I had a confirmation number and prepaid for the room. No apologies, instead she blamed the third party service. She asked if I was travelling alone, suggesting that I didn't have a good reason for a suite. She checked for an available king bed. Nothing. She said she had a room with two doubles. I'm a big guy, that's not working. I said I wanted a refund and would find another hotel. Y'know, if people would just own up and apologize then things would be cool. But when there isn't any consideration for my inconvenience caused by them, then I'd rather not deal with them. I didn't stay there. I can't comment on the rooms. The place appeared to have a clean lobby and the outside was decent. However, I will avoid staying at La Quinta since the service was so disappointing. No apologies.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been more upfront about inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: MariposaSEQ
Reviews.Content: Showed up with a reservation on a week day early in the afternoon but later than the listed check-in time. Was told rooms were still being cleaned and asked to come back later. My wife noticed a small sign on the counter that indicated that all the water to the place would be cut off from 8 - 11 p.m. that evening. The sign was partially covered and the clerk didn't mention it. I called back later and asked about the water cutoff and it was confirmed. No apology for the inconvenience. Ended up at another place that night but had to pay walk-in price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the way to somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: heavenlyjane
Reviews.Content: A bargain price (with AAA discount) and easy to reach. I needed a bed for one night as I was flying in to San Deigo late a night. This place is next to the interstate, easy to find, etc. I got a free upgrade to their biggest suite which was curiously under-furnished. I only stayed 7 hours as I had to be gone early the next day. I like the LaQuinta brand for its cleanliness and realiability. This is not one of their fancier facilities but it lived up to the LaQuinta reputation. It's a 3-star place. Breakfast was the expected stuff - reheat freezer waffles (make-it-yourself would have been nicer). I happily grabbed a few hard-boil eggs for later in the day. Like all La Quintas I have ever stayed at, the bedding/pillows are to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice price”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBuckeye
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this hotel if you are just looking for a place to sleep. Free parking, free internet, free breakfast (nothing special but not bad). The beds are older but they were comfortable and the room was clean. Our only complaint was that the remote didn't work (even after we got new batteries from the front desk). Convenient to many restaurants too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: osibee
Reviews.Content: We attended my husband's cousin's wedding and stayed here. Our room was very clean and spacious. Their breakfast was typical American but was good enough. They have a swimming pool but didn't use it. We had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, decent accomodations, gets the job done.”
Reviews.Author: lytong
Reviews.Content: Clean bed and room area, the free internet is always welcomed. Location is in a suburban area so the general area is safe and pleasant. Being a La Quinta, if the expectation is for a clean, no frills place to live, this La Quinta does its thing well. One of 2 things I didn't like was the bath tub area wasn't cleaned very well. The tub bottom had stains and it didn't bother me though I imagine those with kids would not be too happy. More annoying was how thin the walls were, when those in another room used the taps or shower, I heard the sound of water flowing and it was loud.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: celkiar04
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night in the beginning of April. We were pleasantly surprised by the inside of the hotel. It has been recently re-modeled so everything was new. The rooms were spacious (we stayed in a king room), the sitting chairs comfy, and the bathroom very clean. The hotel staff were extremely nice, even when I had trouble with my room key. They looked into it right away and were very nice when it turned out I was trying to enter the wrong room (oops). There is an elevator right off the parking lot so bringing luggage up was easy. There's a Starbucks, IHOP, and gas station nearby that we took advantage of. The hotel is right off the highway but you can't hear any traffic noise at all once you are in the room. My parents stayed here with us (but in a different room) and my dad is an extremely light sleeper. He didn't have any trouble sleeping that night. The hotel offered free high speed internet which was easy to hook up to in our room. We traveled with 3 dogs (we had one, my parents had two) and the hotel was great to our pets. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wysper
Reviews.Content: we were evacuated to a hotel in the forestorms of 2007 and ended up staying for over 2 weeks the hotel room was clean and was roomy for all 5 of us PLUS our dogs and cats the front desk staff and the housekeeping staff were always so friendly so helpfull and always hospitable my mom has a wheelchair and we didnt even need a handicapped room because the room was roomy enough for her to get around in my kids love the pool its the perfect size to keep a good temp year round the front lobby was always clean and you always felt welcome plenty of shopping in neighboring areas for whatever needs you have and just a short drive down the freeways to go play tourist beds were comfortable everything was easy to use no rocket science for the thermostat will definatly be returning soon

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but slightly scruffy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: allisoniain
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta is perched above Highway 15 with some of the rooms facing directly on to this road. As La Quinta's go this one seems a bit rougher around the edges than most. Rooms are clean and comfortable but the public areas are a bit worn. Pool is good - right temperature and a good size. Free internet which is a big plus and the breakfast is the usual La Quinta fare. OK overall for the price.

Reviews.Title: “DOG Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Thesunnyone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 2 golden retrievers..with no additional costs! No doggie treats, but they had freshly baked chocolate chip cookies in the lobby for us! YUM! The front desk staff, especially Kim was very nice. Our room was quite roomy, nice and clean. There's a tiny bit of grass in the back lot which is nicely lit. It was our first time staying at a La Quinta..and we'll definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good night sleep, clean, and good value”
Reviews.Author: easy4mac
Reviews.Content: This merits an above average to excellent rating relative to other hotels in this class. Based on our web research, it appears that this hotel is between $10 and $40 per night less expensive than others that we were considering. We stayed at this very basic hotel for 5 nights while visiting relatives. The hotel was as clean as they come. The bed was comfortable and the room was large and quiet. For cleanliness, comfort and size I think it ranked up with the best 3 star hotels. We had a small complaint about the shower and they fixed the problem immediately. In terms of amentities this hotel is pretty bare bones. There is a pool which looked clean and a continental breakfast. We didn't participate in the breakfast (looked pretty standard for a hotel of this type) and opted for Starbucks which was right next door (a definite plus for me). There is also an IHOP next door. The health club is off-site a few blocks away. The Hotel is convenient to LaJolla and the suburbs. We had a great stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the cleanest rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JACNHC
Reviews.Content: The carpet in the room we stayed in could have used a major steam cleaning as it was pretty grungy. We stayed on the first floor and noticed that the front door did not totally seal when closed so bugs could get in under the door. We had to dispose of several crickets during our stay. The dining area is fairly small so we opted not to do breakfast there. There is a great IHOP right next door to the hotel and several fast food places. There's a 7-11 nearby. The area was nice, there is a large commercial area located just one exit down the highway going west where there are some supermarkets, a post office, and other stores and eateries. So the location was nice but the hotel could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Hatter_Calc
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta is north of San Diego and La Jolla but was the perfect spot for my family. We were going to places in San Diego and Legoland and this put us in the middle. The rooms were clean and the complimentary breakfast is always a nice touch. The pool was the perfect temp on a hot summer day.

Reviews.Title: “A little old, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: biolanavy
Reviews.Content: The hotel does not deserve more than 1 star on the AAA scale. It was a bit dirty outside and felt old. But everything worked in the room. The breakfast is just OK and was very crowded. The lobby didn't feel well Air-conditioned so it was not comfortable eating breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn San Diego Scripps Poway
HotelInfo.Address: 10185 Paseo Montril, San Diego, CA 92129
